source_note: State baseline derived from Arizona DEQ and municipal recycling rules; local variation is common.

organics.guidance: ADEQ allows composting of food, yard, manure, and agricultural wastes; larger operations may require permits (e.g. DOA, AZPDES, aquifer protection). :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}
organics.bin: Green / yard waste cart or drop-off where local service exists.
organics.notes: Not all cities provide curbside organics collection; check local program availability.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper and cardboard; flatten boxes and remove liners. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}
paper_cardboard.bin: Blue / mixed recycling bin (loose, not bagged). :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}
paper_cardboard.notes: Greasy pizza boxes, waxed paper, and heavily soiled paper are often excluded. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle glass bottles and jars (clear, green, amber), rinsed and with lids removed. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}
glass_containers.bin: Mixed recycling bin or separate glass bin, if supported locally. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}
glass_containers.notes: Non-container glass, broken glass, ceramics usually not accepted. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}
provenance: Municipal glass recycling rules in AZ (Scottsdale, Phoenix) :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle clean aluminum, steel, tin cans (empty, rinsed). :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}
metal_containers.notes: No large scrap metal or hazardous containers (paint, chemicals) in curbside bins. :contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}
provenance: Local city recycling rules (Scottsdale, Phoenix etc.) :contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}

plastics.guidance: Recycle rigid plastic containers (e.g. bottles, jugs, tubs) as accepted locally. :contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}
plastics.notes: Plastic bags, film, and foam typically *not* accepted in curbside bins â€” use store drop-offs. :contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Arizona does **not** have a statewide beverage container deposit / refund (CRV) program.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Include in local recycling where accepted.
beverage_containers_crv.notes: No state-level deposit or refund system for drink containers.
provenance: State recycling policy summaries, absence in municipal rules

household_batteries.guidance: Arizona follows federal Universal Waste rules for rechargeable and lead-acid batteries; drop-off options vary by locality. :contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}
household_batteries.bin: Take to hazardous waste / battery drop-off events or facilities.
household_batteries.notes: Do not place batteries in trash or regular recycling bins due to fire/hazard risk. :contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}
provenance: Arizona hazardous waste / battery disposal rules via ADEQ

e_waste.guidance: Arizona law prohibits disposal of covered electronic devices in landfills (since Jan 1, 2013). :contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21} Recent legislation (e.g. SB 1419) is expanding manufacturer-led e-waste collection programs. :contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22}
e_waste.bin: Drop-off at certified e-waste collection sites or events. :contentReference[oaicite:23]{index=23}
e_waste.notes: Use R2 / e-Stewards certified recyclers for best practice. :contentReference[oaicite:24]{index=24}
provenance: Arizona law HB 2614 on e-waste disposal prohibition :contentReference[oaicite:25]{index=25}

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic bags, wraps, and film are not accepted in curbside recycling in most AZ cities. :contentReference[oaicite:28]{index=28}
plastic_bags_and_film.bin: Return them to store drop-off bins (e.g. grocery stores). :contentReference[oaicite:29]{index=29}
plastic_bags_and_film.notes: They often jam recycling machinery and cause contamination.

bulky_items.guidance: Bulky items (furniture, mattresses, appliances) require special pickup or drop off at local transfer stations or waste facilities.
bulky_items.notes: Fees or appointments may apply depending on jurisdiction.
provenance: Municipal waste & recycling service rules (various AZ cities)
